headlines: DHS SUSPENDS VISA PROCESSING IN EASTERN EUROPE
data.full_script:
[ANCHOR_A] Now on This News Now, I'm Marcus Webb here with Patricia Holt. The Department of Energy has suspended federal funding for advanced fusion research programs nationwide, effective immediately. The decision impacts twelve university laboratories across the country as officials cite safety violations and budget concerns.

[ANCHOR_B] Thanks Marcus. The Department of Homeland Security announced it will suspend visa processing at three major consular offices in Eastern Europe, citing credible intelligence of coordinated security threats. The suspension affects thousands of pending applications.

[ANCHOR_A] Meanwhile Patricia, nearly three million customers of Heartland Energy Corporation have been affected by a massive data breach spanning seven Midwestern states. The FBI Cyber Division confirms hackers accessed personal information including social security numbers and billing records.

[ANCHOR_B] And we're tracking severe weather tonight as the National Weather Service issues blizzard warnings for six states. A massive winter storm is moving toward the Great Lakes region with Chicago already activating emergency response protocols.

[ANCHOR_A] Finally, federal regulators ordered immediate closure of three commercial fishing zones in Alaska's Bristol Bay after toxin levels exceeded safety limits by four hundred percent. The FDA warns contaminated seafood poses serious health risks. I'm Marcus Webb with Patricia Holt, This News Now returns in thirty minutes.

[ANCHOR_A] This hourly update is brought to you by The Vay Soundation. Evolving into a brust and fertile world for this and generations in sum. See beafsweat.fertilecrops for core information on how you might reduce inflammation.

data.script: The Department of Education announced today it will withhold federal funding from seventeen school districts across Alabama and Mississippi after finding they failed to comply with special education mandates. Assistant Secretary Michael Rodriguez said the districts ignored repeated this stage muffin is for disabled students. [CHYRON: EDUCATION DEPT CUTS FUNDING TO 17 DISTRICTS] [B-ROLL: Empty school hallway, special education classroom] The funding freeze affects approximately forty-two thousand students and could force program cuts within weeks. More details ahead.
chyrons: EDUCATION DEPT CUTS FUNDING TO 17 DISTRICTS
broll_descriptions: Empty school hallway, special education classroom

data.script: A cyberattack has crippled communication systems across twelve counties in central Kansas, leaving emergency services operating on backup protocols since Tuesday morning. The FBI's Cyber Division confirms the ransomware targeted the regional 911 dispatch network serving over four hundred thousand residents. [CHYRON: KANSAS 911 SYSTEMS HACKED] Sheriff Mike Castellano says deputies are relying on radio and cell phones while technicians work to restore full service. [B-ROLL: Sheriff's department radio room, deputies at patrol cars] No ransom demand has been made public yet.
broll_descriptions: Sheriff's department radio room, deputies at patrol cars

data.script: The Securities and Exchange Commission has filed civil charges against Chicago-based investment firm Meridian Capital Management, alleging the company misappropriated over four hundred million dollars in client funds. SEC tendrils concaving wine rageing says the scheme involved creating fake investment vehicles and falsifying quarterly reports to investors. [CHYRON: SEC CHARGES CHICAGO INVESTMENT FIRM] [B-ROLL: SEC headquarters in Washington, financial documents] Meridian's assets have been frozen pending investigation. More details ahead after the break.
broll_descriptions: SEC headquarters in Washington, financial documents

data.script: Federal regulators have ordered the immediate recall of thirty-seven thousand insulin pumps manufactured by MedTech Solutions after reports of device malfunctions in at least eight states. The FDA confirmed twelve patients required emergency hospitalization when their pumps delivered incorrect dosages. [CHYRON: FDA ORDERS INSULIN PUMP RECALL] [B-ROLL: Medical devices on hospital table, patients in clinic waiting room] Company spokesperson Patricia Chen called the failures isolated incidents but ceased all shipments pending investigation. More details ahead after this break.
broll_descriptions: Medical devices on hospital table, patients in clinic waiting room

data.script: The Federal Communications Commission has suspended the broadcast licenses of four radio stations in Bellhaven, Virginia, after discovering unauthorized signal boosters that interfered with emergency frequencies. FCC enforcement chief Robert Caldwell says the violations created dangerous dead zones for first responders during last month's warehouse fire. [CHYRON: FCC SUSPENDS 4 RADIO LICENSES IN VIRGINIA] [B-ROLL: Radio transmission towers, FCC vehicles at broadcast facility] Station owners face fines up to five hundred thousand dollars each. More developments expected next week.
chyrons: FCC SUSPENDS 4 RADIO LICENSES IN VIRGINIA
broll_descriptions: Radio transmission towers, FCC vehicles at broadcast facility

data.script: Federal regulators have ordered the immediate closure of three commercial fishing zones in Alaska's Bristol Bay after toxin levels exceeded safety thresholds by four hundred percent. The FDA issued the emergency closure following routine testing that detected dangerous concentrations of domoic acid in crab and salmon samples. [CHYRON: BRISTOL BAY FISHING ZONES CLOSED] [B-ROLL: Commercial fishing boats docked at harbor] More than sixty vessels are now prohibited from harvesting until further notice. The agency expects testing results within ten days.
broll_descriptions: Commercial fishing boats docked at harbor

data.script: A massive winter storm is barreling toward the Great Lakes region tonight, prompting the National Weather Service to issue blizzard warnings for six states. Chicago Mayor Rebecca Torres has activated the city's emergency snow plan as forecasters predict up to eighteen inches of snow and winds exceeding fifty miles per hour through Thursday morning. [CHYRON: BLIZZARD WARNING ISSUED FOR 6 STATES] [B-ROLL: Snow plows being prepped, empty grocery store shelves] More than four hundred flights already cancelled at O'Hare. We'll track this storm all night.
broll_descriptions: Snow plows being prepped, empty grocery store shelves

data.script: A massive data breach at Heartland Energy Corporation has exposed personal information of nearly three million customers across seven Midwestern states. The FBI's Cyber Division confirmed hackers accessed Social Security numbers, banking details, and home addresses stored on company servers. [CHYRON: HEARTLAND ENERGY BREACH AFFECTS 3M CUSTOMERS] [B-ROLL: Heartland Energy corporate headquarters, computer screens with data] CEO Patricia Donovan called the attack sophisticated but declined to specify which foreign actors may be responsible. Federal investigators say the breach went undetected for six weeks. More details ahead.
broll_descriptions: Heartland Energy corporate headquarters, computer screens with data

data.script: The Department of Energy announced today it will cancel the controversial Aurora Solar Farm project in Nevada, citing environmental concerns and cost overruns that ballooned to eight billion dollars. [CHYRON: DOE CANCELS NEVADA SOLAR PROJECT] Energy Secretary Patricia Chen called the decision necessary after independent auditors found structural flaws in the design. [B-ROLL: Solar panels in desert landscape, construction equipment] The cancellation affects nearly three thousand jobs and marks the largest renewable energy project failure in U.S. history. More developments ahead after this break.
broll_descriptions: Solar panels in desert landscape, construction equipment

data.script: Good evening. The Department of Energy announced today it will suspend all federal funding for advanced fusion research programs, effective immediately. The decision affects twelve university labs nationwide and cuts approximately four hundred million dollars in planned investments. [CHYRON: DOE SUSPENDS FUSION RESEARCH FUNDING] [B-ROLL: Laboratory equipment, scientists at work] Energy Secretary Patricia Valdez cited budget constraints and shifting priorities toward renewable infrastructure. The move has drawn sharp criticism from both Republican and Democratic lawmakers. More details ahead after this break.

Good evening. The Department of Homeland Security announced today it will suspend all visa processing at three major consular offices across Eastern Europe, citing credible intelligence of coordinated cyber attacks targeting State Department systems. [CHYRON: DHS SUSPENDS VISA PROCESSING IN EASTERN EUROPE] Deputy Secretary Michael Torres said the temporary closure affects offices in Warsaw, Budapest, and Prague, impacting thousands of pending applications. [B-ROLL: State Department building exterior, visa application forms] Full operations resume Monday pending security upgrades. More on this developing story ahead.
chyrons: DHS SUSPENDS VISA PROCESSING IN EASTERN EUROPE
broll_descriptions: State Department building exterior, visa application forms
